chapter.title: Modules
chapter.para:
Shongo consists of the following applications (modules):
Controller
Controller (shongo-controller) is main backend application in Shongo. In each domain you must run exactly one Controller. Controller uses Java to run and PostgreSQL to store data.
Connector
Connector (shongo-connector) is application to control one or several devices (e.g., Cisco MCU or Adobe Connect server). In each domain you can run several Connectors and each of them can control several devices.
Connector uses Java to run and JADE middleware to communicate with Controller.
Web Client
Web Client (shongo-client-web) is a web application which can be used by users to use Shongo.
Web Client uses Java to run and XML-RPC to communicate with Controller. Web Client can run under Apache proxy.
Command-Line Client
Command-Line Client (shongo-client-cli) is a console application which can be used by administrators to manage Controller.
Command-Line Client uses Perl to run and XML-RPC to communicate with Controller.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para:
Before installing Shongo you must first install the following software on target system:
Git
Git is required to download Shongo source code.
How to install git on Debian: apt-get install git Check that git is installed: git --version
Java JDK 1.6 (Oracle)
Oracle Java Development Kit is required to build all Shongo applications and Oracle Java Runtime Environment (which is included in JDK) is required to run all Shongo applications (Controller, Connector, Client Web and Command-Line Client).
How to install java on Debian:
echo "deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/webupd8team/java/ubuntu trusty main" | \ tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/webupd8team-java.list echo "deb-src http://ppa.launchpad.net/webupd8team/java/ubuntu trusty main" | \ tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/webupd8team-java.list apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys EEA14886 apt-get update apt-get install oracle-java6-installer
Check that java is installed: java -version
Maven 2.2.1
Maven is required to build all Shongo applications (Controller, Connector, Client Web and Command-Line Client).
How to install mvn on Debian: apt-get install maven2 Check that mvn is installed: mvn --version
PostgreSQL
PostgreSQL is required only if you want to install Controller. Other Shongo applications don't require it.
How to install postgresql on Debian: apt-get install postgresql Check that psql is installed: psql --version

section.title: Build
section.para: To build Shongo you must first download it's source code.

Clone the Git repository with the Shongo source code to location where you want have the Shongo installed (e.g., /app/shongo). You can clone the source code from the development repository (if you have access to it): git clone <user>@homeproj.cesnet.cz:shongo /app/shongo Or you can clone it from the GitHub: git clone https://github.com/shongo/shongo.git /app/shongo
Then go to location with the Shongo source code, checkout version of Shongo which you want to build and build it by Maven.
cd /app/shongo git checkout v0.7.0 mvn package
To list available versions of Shongo use the following command: git tag It will output the versions in the following format:
v0.5.0 v0.5.1 v0.5.2 v0.6.0 v0.7.0
Maven builds all Java applications (Controller, Connector and Client Web) and prepares the Perl application for usage (Command-Line Client).

If you want to install Shongo for domain which already have some Shongo extensions (e.g., custom design for Web Client), you should clone also the Git repository with the extension. For example for CESNET domain you should clone the following repository from GitHub:
git clone https://github.com/shongo/shongo-domain-cesnet.git \ /app/shongo/shongo-domain/cesnet
The domain extension should be placed to folder <shongo>/shongo-domain/<domain-name>, where <shongo> is the location where you cloned the Shongo source code (e.g., /app/shongo) and the <domain-name> is the name of the domain for which you want to store the extension (e.g., cesnet).

section.title: Install services
section.para: Once the Shongo is built you can install one or more Shongo applications into your system. You can install only Controller, Connector and Client Web into your system as service. The Command-Line Client application must be used from the installed location (e.g., /app/shongo/shongo-deployment/bin/shongo-client-cli.sh).
All following paths are relative to root folder where you cloned and built the Shongo source code (e.g., /app/shongo).

Services can be installed by running the following command as superuser: shongo-deployment/service/shongo-install.sh <applications> The command takes one argument <applications> which can be list of Shongo application names separated by spaces which should be installed or it can be leaved empty to install all applications.

para.screen:
# Become superuser su root
# Install Controller and Client-Web applications shongo-deployment/service/shongo-install.sh shongo-controller shongo-client-web
# Install only Connector application shongo-deployment/service/shongo-install.sh shongo-connector
# Install all Shongo applications (Controller, Connector and Client Web) shongo-deployment/service/shongo-install.sh

section.para:
Services can be uninstalled by running the following command as superuser:
# Become superuser su root
# Uninstall all installed Shongo applications shongo-deployment/service/shongo-uninstall.sh

section.title: Services
section.para:
To start/stop/restart all services use: service shongo [start|stop|restart]
To start/stop/restart single services use: service [shongo-controller|shongo-connector|shongo-client-web] [start|stop|restart]
To show status of all services use: service shongo status
To show status of single services use: service [shongo-controller|shongo-connector|shongo-client-web] status
